abstract: James D. Risher and Daniel Sebastian fraudulently promised annual returns of as much as 124 percent, the S.E.C. said in a lawsuit.
snippet: James D. Risher and Daniel Sebastian fraudulently promised annual returns of as much as 124 percent, the S.E.C. said in a lawsuit.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission sued two Florida men, claiming that they had defrauded teachers and retirees in a $22 million Ponzi scheme by posing as a private equity fund while enriching themselves.

headline.main: 2 in Florida Are Charged In $22 Million Ponzi Scheme
headline.print_headline: 2 in Florida Are Charged In $22 Million Ponzi Scheme
